Dear Mr. Gonzalez:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention Standards and Prohibitions
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a
youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 12/2/23, staff member had a physical altercation with a youth.
Another youth attempted to intervene. Youth's upper right
shoulder was bruised and tender after the altercation. Another
staff member intervened to separate the staff member and youth.
The altercation was due to staff advising youth they were not
allowed to go to a wrestling match. After the altercation, the staff
member drove the other youth to the event.
Investigation Interviews:
Supervisor 1/Complaint Source was interviewed face to face at
the facility on December 5, 2023, and via phone on December
18, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Supervisor 1
reported she had reviewed the video footage on 12/04/2023 due to
the report of Youth A assaulting Staff 1 and she had concerns about
a physical fight occurring between Youth A and Staff 1. She reported
Youth A has had behavioral issues within the home and has been in
a handful of fights at the facility. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 was
put on leave pending this investigation and will not have interactions
with the youth. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 had been terminated on
December 15, 2023, due to the video showing him pushing Youth A.
She reported she never directly heard from Staff 1 that he wanted to
“beat the kids” but Supervisor 2 did notify her of this concern after the
video review. Supervisor 1 reported Staff 1 has been sarcastic and
blunt with some of his thoughts and was working on trauma informed
care. She reported Staff 2 is a brand new third shift staff and has not
been fully trained in restraint training.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
5, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 1 reported he
came into early to work on December 2, 2023, to take Youth B to a
wrestling game at his school. He reported when he arrived to
transport Youth B, both Youth A and Youth B came out to his car.
Staff 1 reported Youth A was suspended from school and was not
allowed to come. He reported he told Youth A that he was not
allowed to come, and he needed to go back into the home. Youth A
began to argue with Staff 1 about the situation and Youth A called
Staff 1 a “negro”. Staff 1 reported after he heard that, his own
emotions heightened, and he pushed Youth A away from the car.
2

Youth A then started to physically attack Staff 1 and punched Staff 1
in the face. Staff 1 reported he attempted to do a bear hug with Youth
A to try to get him into a restraint to stop the punching, but Youth A
punched him again. Staff 1 reported he does not know if he punched
Youth A back or not. He reported Staff 2 came and got Youth A back
into the home. He reported he drove Youth B to school to go to his
wrestling game and Staff 1 reported he called the police when he
returned about the situation. He reported he is trained in CPI restraint
model, and knows that he did not use it how he was supposed to in
this situation. Staff 1 reported he tried to tell Youth A to stop hitting
him, but it did not help. Staff 1 reported looking back at the situation
he knows he should have not pushed Youth A and should not have
let his emotions get the best of him. He reported he debated on
allowing Youth A to just come to the game but when he called him
“negro” his emotions just took the best of him. Staff 1 reported he
could not get another staff for support because this occurred outside
and there a was new third shift staff member working. Staff 1
reported he used to live in this facility as a youth himself and only
wants the best for the youth. He stated he knows Youth A struggles
with his behaviors but does not want to press charges against him
because he does not want to set up a negative future for Youth A.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
6, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Interpreter
assisted with the translation for the interview. Youth A reported
he was suspended from school, and he had talked to Supervisor 1
who told him on the weekend he was allowed to go on outings. He
reported on December 2, 2023, he wanted to go watch Youth B’s
wrestling match and walked out to Staff 1’s car. Youth A reported he
began to argue with Staff 1 because he was telling him he could not
go when Supervisor 1 gave permission for him to go. Youth A
reported Staff 1 came out of the car, pushed him away, and told him
if he did not move Staff 1 was going to shoot him. He reported he got
upset with Staff 1 touching him. Youth A punched him and then
began to fight. Youth A reported when they were behind the car, Staff
1 picked him up by his legs and threw him to the ground. He stated
that it hurt the right side of his shoulder. Youth A was asked if he got
medical attention and he stated he told Supervisor 1 he did not want
to go to the doctor and continues to refuse. Youth A reported he ran
away from the area after the fight. He stated before this incident
occurred, he never had a good relationship with Staff 1 and does not
know why. Youth A reported he feels safe at the facility and could go
to Supervisor 1 for support if needed.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on December
6, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Interpreter
assisted with the translation for the interview. Youth B reported
he asked Staff 1 to come in early to take him to his wrestling match
3

at school on December 2, 2023. He reported when he went to Staff
1’s car, Youth A had come with him. Youth B reported Youth A was
not allowed to come because he had been suspended from school
and when you are suspended from school the house rule is you are
not allowed on outings. Youth B reported Staff 1 started to argue with
Youth A about not being allowed to come and Youth B tried to
encourage Youth A to go back inside. He reported Youth A had
made a comment about how if he is not allowed to come then Staff 1
can just run him over. Youth B reported he witnessed Staff 1 push
Youth A away from the car and Youth A started to fight with Staff 1.
He reported both Staff 1 and Youth A were fighting, and they ended
up on the ground. Then Youth A got back up and began to fight
again. Youth B reported he tried to break up the fight at one point
and then ran inside to get help from Staff 2. He reported he never
heard Staff 1 say anything to Youth A but reported he heard Youth A
cursing at Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on December 18, 2023, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Staff 2 reported he worked the
night shift on December 2, 2023. Staff 1 had come to pick up Youth B
for his school wrestling match that morning. He reported Youth A
walked out of the home as well and he told Youth A he was not
allowed to go due to his consequences in the home. Staff 2 reported
he just let Youth A go out of the home as he was aware Staff 1 knew
Youth A was on consequences at the home. He reported after a few
minutes he opened the front door to see if Staff 1 had left and he saw
Youth A and Staff 1 were holding on to one another. Staff 2 reported
he went outside to break up Youth A and Staff 1 and at the time no
one was punching one another. He reported once they were broken
apart, Youth A punched Staff 1 and then Youth A ran away from the
car. Staff 1 then took Youth B to the wrestling match and Staff 2 got
Youth A into the home. Staff 2 reported he never heard Youth A or
Staff 1 say anything to one another, he only saw them holding on to
one another. He reported he never saw Staff 1 punch or push Youth
A.
Supervisor 2 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
December 6, 2023, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker.
Supervisor 2 reported he received a message from Staff 1 on
December 2, 2023, that Youth A had physically assaulted Staff 1. He
reported Staff 1 stated he wanted to press charges against Youth A
with the police. Supervisor 2 reported due to this report he watched
the video footage and saw the concerns of Staff 1’s actions towards
Youth A and immediately put him on leave. He reported he has been
working with Staff 1 to be trauma informed and not taking the words
from the youth so personally. Supervisor 2 reported he has had to
redirect Staff 1 from stating that he wanted to “beat the kids” due to
their behaviors and told him that is not allowed. He reported they
4

have discussed about Staff 1 being a former resident at the facility
and how policies and procedures have changed to be more trauma
informed.
Video Footage Reviewed:
Video footage of 12/02/2023 was reviewed on 12/05/2023, in
collaboration with Supervisor 1 and MDHHS Worker. The video
footage is of the outside parking lot in front of the home with the time
starting at 6:09am and there is no sound to the video footage. A car
is parked in front of the entrance. Youth A and Youth B walk towards
the car. Youth B opens the door to the front passenger seat and gets
into the car. Youth A opens the door to the back passenger seat and
leans his body into the car. After about 30 seconds, the car begins to
reverse as Youth A is still standing with the back passenger door
open. The car stops after about two seconds and Staff 1 gets out of
the driver seat and walks towards Youth A. Staff 1 has his finger
pointed at the facility home and appears to be talking to Youth A.
Staff 1 is seen then taking both of his hands and pushing Youth A's
chest away from the car. Youth A then comes back to Staff 1 and it
appears a physical fight occurs. Youth B gets out of the car, goes
over to the fight, and tries to break it up. Youth A and Staff 1 are
behind the car and appear to end up on the ground. Due to the
camera angle, it being dark and rainy, there is not a clear picture of
how they got on the ground. They get up off the ground and are
continuing to wrestle one another standing up. Youth B runs to the
house and Staff 2 comes out of the house to the area of the fight. It is
never seen in the video of Staff 2 putting his hands on either Youth A
or Staff 1 but Youth A and Staff 1 stop fighting. Youth B heads back
to the car and Youth A tries to get into the car again but Staff 1
pushes him away. Youth A then goes back to Staff 1’s area and Staff
1 begins to chase him away behind a van. Staff 2 walks over to the
van and it is seen Youth A runs out of the camera sight. Staff 1 walks
back to the car and Youth B gets into the car. Youth B and Staff 1
drive off and Youth A walks back towards Staff 2 to go back inside
the house.
Documentation Reviewed:
- Bethany Employee Handbook- Staff are prohibited from the
use of physical or verbal harassment, violence, abuse, threats
or intimation towards a youth.
- Bethany Christan Services Emergency Restraint Policy-
This policy states pushing a youth on any part of their body is
prohibited.
- Staff 1’s Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no formal
disciplinary action noted with his file. Staff 1 does have a
coaching form completed within his HR file due to Staff 1 not
intervening when two youth were physically fighting. This
coaching form was dated 10/31/2023 and noted how Staff 1
5

can feel more confident in de-escalating a crisis situation. The
safety plan notes that Staff 1 should ask for support when
needed and to use verbal de-escalation. Staff 1 is up to date
on all her training including CPI training dated 06/07/2023.
- Police Report dated 12/02/2023- Staff 1 made the police
report and within his victim statement, he reported that Youth
A got into an argument with Staff 1 and punched Staff 1 on his
left shoulder and his head. Staff 1 reported to police he
wanted to press criminal charges against Youth A for assault.
Youth A reported to police that Staff 1 stated he was going to
shoot Youth A and then pushed him. Youth A reported he
punched Staff 1.
Analysis Based on the interviews conducted and video footage reviewed
there is evidence to show Staff 1 pushed Youth A while outside of
the facility on 12/02/2023. The facility is also found in non-
compliance as Staff 1 has a confirmed case due to the threats of
physical harm.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
2023C0000769SI dated 10/20/23 CAP approved on 11/08/23
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
